To decide the question of an absolute truth one must consider truth by definition. 
 
 If we define truth as the lining up of reality with what is stated ("There is gas in my car" is truth only if there is really gas in my car.) then there must be an absolute truth. 
 
 To say there is no absolute truth is ludicrous, because it is a statement that is "absolute." The word "no" is a final. It is an absolute. The statement there is no absolute truth must be either absolutely true or absolutely false, because the word "no" is an absolute. 
 
 It cannot be absolutely true because it would then contradict itself as an absolute truth. Therefore, an absolute truth MUST exist.
 
 Given that, morality is another question. The real question is "who decides what is absolutely true?" 
 
 Humans are a possibility. However, given our unreliable nature, I am unwilling to go to far with that one. 
 
 The universe did it randomly is another possibility. This would take care of the morality problem, but would contradict nearly every other physical law, most specifically entropy.
 
 The self existent supreme being that made the universe and all its contents who exists outside of time, makes the most sense. It is the one I go with.
 
 No, I want to stay away from a debate of religion. That last part is simply my opinion and not an answer to the question. As to absolute truth, I would like to see anyone defeat my logic.
